snippet: There have been enough horror stories about frozen PayPal accounts to make some companies think twice about using the service, Brian X. Chen reports on Thursday in The New York Times. The victims include individual sellers, start-up companies,...
abstract: There have been enough horror stories about frozen PayPal accounts to make some companies think twice about using the service, Brian X. Chen reports on Thursday in The New York Times. The victims include individual sellers, start-up companies, creative artists and impromptu philanthropists.

headline.main: Daily Report: PayPal Measures Cause Trouble for Start-Ups
